p: Four subtypes of HPIV (HPIV-1, 2, 3, and 4) have been identified, and HPIV-3 is the most prevalent serotype of infections. Among adults hospitalized with pneumonia, HPIV-3 was found in 3.1% of patients ( 7, 8). The causative virus in our patients was HPIV-1, a subtype found in 2.5% of adult pneumonias ( 5, 9). Although our patients recovered successfully, Tamaki et al. reported a fatal case of viremia due to HPIV-1 in a patient with adult T-cell leukemia-lymphoma treated with mogamulizumab ( 10), which indicates that HPIV-1 can also be a fatal pathogen in immunocompromised patients.
